tit.e: Karyaku no sodo (a rebellion in the Karyaku era)
Karyaku no sodo (a rebellion in the Karyaku era)
Karyaku no Sodo (a rebellion in the Karyaku era)
tit.cmt: カッコ書きの内容は後述されていることから、削除しました。→最新の用語統一リストに従って、補足を戻しました。タイトルであるため、sodo を Sodo に修正しました。

sen.j: 嘉暦の騒動 （かりゃくのそうどう）は、鎌倉時代末期の正中 (元号)3年（1326年）、鎌倉幕府の執権である北条氏得宗家の家督継承を巡る内管領の長崎氏と、外戚安達氏の抗争による内紛。
sen.e: Karyaku no sodo was a conflict in 1326, towards the end of the Kamakura period, within the Tokuso family (Hojo's main family), or between the Nagasaki family, whose head was Uchi-Kanrei (the butler of the Tokuso family), and the Adachi family, whose head was a maternal relative of the Tokuso family, concerning inheriting the head post of the Tokuso family.

Karyaku no sodo refers to a conflict in 1326, towards the end of the Kamakura period, between Nagasaki Takasuke, a minister to the Tokuso family and the Adachi clan, whose head was a maternal relative of the Tokuso family over inheriting the head post of the Tokuso family within the Hojo clan, which was regent to the Kamakura bakufu shogunate.
sen.cmt: Research seems to point towards ascribing the word "clan" rather than family here.
sen.e: "Karyaku no sodo" (Karyaku rebellion) refers to a conflict in 1326, towards the end of the Kamakura period, between Nagasaki Takasuke, a minister to the Tokuso family and the Adachi clan, whose head was a maternal relative of the Tokuso family over inheriting the head post of the Tokuso family within the Hojo clan, which was regent to the Kamakura bakufu shogunate.
sen.cmt: 統一リストその他（2009/6/29）の指示に従い、Karyaku no sodo をダブルコーテーションで括り、用語集の定訳に従いその英訳を追記しました。

sen.j: 正中3年（1326年）3月13日、14代執権北条高時が病のために24歳で出家する。
sen.e: On March 13 (in the old calendar), 1326, Shikken (regent to the shogun) Takatoki HOJO became a priest due to illness.
On March 13 (in the old calendar), 1326, Takatoki HOJO, the 14th shikken (regent to the shogun) became a priest due to illness as he approached his 24th birthday.
sen.cmt: The age was ommitted
sen.e: On April 24, 1326, Takatoki HOJO, the 14th shikken (regent to the shogun) became a priest due to illness at the age of 24.
sen.cmt: 日付を修正しました。「24歳で」as he approached his 24th birthday を at the age of 24 に修正しました。

sen.j: 内管領長崎氏は、同じ得宗被官である五大院宗繁の妹常葉前を母として前年12月に産まれた高時の長子北条邦時を得宗家の後継者に推し、執権職を継承するまでの中継ぎとして北条氏庶流の北条貞顕を15代執権に推挙する。
sen.e: Uchi-kanrei Nagasaki recommended, as the next head of the Tokuso family, Kunitoki HOJO, Takatoki's eldest son who was born in December of the previous year and whose mother was Troika no Mae, a sister of Muneshige GODAIIN, who was also a retainer of the Tokuso family, and recommended Sadaaki HOJO, a branch Hojo family head to the temporary the 15th Shikken post until Kunitoki became able to inherit the Shikken post
sen.cmt: 常葉前： 正しい読み、不明です。
sen.e: Nagasaki Takasuke, minister to the Tokuso family recommended Kunitoki HOJO, Takatoki's eldest son born in December the previous year and whose mother was Troika no Mae, a sister of Muneshige GODAIIN, who was also a retainer of the Tokuso family as the next head of the Tokuso family, and he also recommended Sadaaki HOJO, head of the branch Hojo clan as a temporary 15th shikken (regent to the shogun) until Kunitoki became able to inherit the regency.
sen.cmt: I can't but help feel that Tokuso might be best without the addition of the word family but have resisted the temptation to remove the word. Tried to make the meaning clearer by inserting a translation for [shikken].
sen.e: Nagasaki Takasuke, uchikanrei (head of Tokuso Family) recommended Kunitoki HOJO, Takatoki's eldest son born in December the previous year and whose mother was Troika no Mae, a sister of Muneshige GODAIIN, who was also a retainer of the Tokuso family as the next head of the Tokuso family, and he also recommended Sadaaki HOJO, head of the branch Hojo clan as a temporary 15th shikken (regent to the shogun) until Kunitoki became able to inherit the regency.
sen.cmt: 「内管領長崎氏」minister to the Tokuso family を用語集の定訳に従い、uchikanrei (head of Tokuso Family) に修正しました。

sen.j: 貞顕の叔母は五大院氏に嫁いでおり、縁戚関係があった。
sen.e: With his aunt having become a wife of a member of the Godaiin family, Sadaaki was a relative of the Tokuso family.
With his aunt having married Godaiin, Sadaaki was a relative of the Tokuso family.
sen.cmt: Wording
sen.e: With his aunt having married Godaiin, Sadaaki was a relative of the Tokuso family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 貞顕は高時の出家に伴い5度に渡って出家を願い出たが、長崎氏によって慰留されていた。
sen.e: As Takatoki became a priest, Sadaaki also asked for becoming a priest himself five times but was persuaded not to do so by Nagasaki.
As Takatoki became a priest, on five occasions Sadaaki also asked if he could become one, but was persuaded not to do so by Nagasaki.
sen.cmt: Wording
sen.e: As Takatoki became a priest, on five occasions Sadaaki also asked if he could become one, but was persuaded not to do so by Nagasaki.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 高時の正室は安達時顕の娘であり、外戚である安達氏は得宗被官を母とする邦時の誕生の際にも不快の態度を示し、高時の母覚海円成と安達一族は御産所にも高時の前にも姿を現さなかった。
sen.e: The legal wife of Takatoki was a daughter of Tokiaki ADACHI, and Adachi, being the maternal relative of the Tokuso family, showed displeasure even at the birth of Kunitoki whose mother was a retainer of the Tokuso family, without Kakukai Enjo, Takatoki's mother, nor anybody of the Adachi clan appearing in the birth place nor in front of Takatoki.
sen.cmt: 覚海円成： 正しい読み不明です。
sen.e: Takatoki's legal wife was Tokiaki ADACHI's daughter, and Adachi, being a maternal relative of the Tokuso family, showed displeasure even at the birth of Kunitoki (whose mother was a retainer of the Tokuso family), and neither Kakukai Enjo, Takatoki's mother, nor anybody from the Adachi clan made an appearance either at the birth or in front of Takatoki.
sen.cmt: Nor was used without the word neither...
sen.e: Takatoki's legal wife was Tokiaki ADACHI's daughter, and Adachi, being a maternal relative of the Tokuso family, showed displeasure even at the birth of Kunitoki (whose mother was a retainer of the Tokuso family), and neither Kakukai Enjo, Takatoki's mother, nor anybody from the Adachi clan made an appearance either at the birth or in front of Takatoki.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 安達氏側は邦時の家督継承を阻止するべく、高時の弟で大方殿の子北条泰家を高時の後継として推していた。
sen.e: To prevent Kunitoki from inheriting the head post of the Tokuso family, the Adachi family side recommended Yasuie HOJO, Takatoki's younger brother and a son of Okatadono (Kakukai Enjo), as the successor of Takatoki.

To prevent Kunitoki from inheriting the head post of the Tokuso family, the Adachi clan recommended Yasuie HOJO, Takatoki's younger brother and son of Okatadono (Kakukai Enjo), as the successor to Takatoki.
sen.cmt: cf. G4
sen.e: To prevent Kunitoki from inheriting the head post of the Tokuso family, the Adachi clan recommended Yasuie HOJO, Takatoki's younger brother and son of Okatadono (Kakukai Enjo), as the successor to Takatoki.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外処理」を、移動しました。

sen.j: 3月16日朝、貞顕の元に執権就任を告げる長崎氏の使者が訪れた。
sen.e: In the morning of March 16 (in the old calendar), a messenger of Nagasaki visited Sadaaki to announce that he had been appointed to the Shikken post, and being pleased with it, Sadaaki became to attend Hyojo (conferences in the bakufu).
On the morning of March 16, a messenger of Nagasaki visited Sadaaki to announce that he had been appointed to the Shikken post.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理[being pleased with it]はすこし曖昧と思います。
sen.e: On the morning of April 27, a messenger of Nagasaki visited Sadaaki to announce that he had been appointed to the Shikken post.
sen.cmt: 「一原文一訳文の例外処理」を、移動しました。日付を修正しました。

sen.j: 貞顕は素直に喜びその日から評定に出席した。
sen.e: Sadaaki, pleased by the news, duly attended Hyojo (conferences in the bakufu).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Sadaaki, pleased by the news, duly attended Hyojo (conferences in the bakufu).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし同日に泰家がこれを恥辱として出家を遂げる。
sen.e: However, on the same day, Yasuie became a priest saying that such a situation was a disgrace for him.
However, on the same day, Yasuie became a priest saying that such a situation was a disgrace for him.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: However, on the same day, Yasuie became a priest saying that such a situation was a disgrace for him.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 泰家に続いて多くの人々が出家し、これらは貞顕の執権就任に不満を抱く人々が多かった事の表れであった。
sen.e: Many persons became a priest following Yasuie, showing that many persons had displeasure about the appointment of Sadaaki to the Shikken post.
Many people did the same thing as Yasuie, showing that a lot of people were dissatisified with the decision to appoint Sadaaki to the Shikken post.
sen.cmt: personsをpeopleに変更などの修正しました。
sen.e: Many people did the same thing as Yasuie, showing that a lot of people were dissatisfied with the decision to appoint Sadaaki to the Shikken post.
sen.cmt: dissatisified スペルミスのため dissatisfied に修正しました。

sen.j: 憤った泰家とその母大方殿が貞顕を殺そうとしているという風説が流れ、窮地に立たされた貞顕は3月26日に15代執権を辞任し、出家を遂げた。
sen.e: It was rumored that angry Yasuie and Okata dono, his mother, were trying to kill Sadaaki, and being forced into a corner, Sadaaki resigned from the 15th Shikken post on March 26, becoming a priest.

It was rumored that an angry Yasuie and Okata (his mother) contemplated an attempt on Sadaaki's life, and forced into a corner, Sadaaki resigned his position as the 15th regent to the shogun on March 26, to become a priest.
sen.cmt: trying to killは強すぎるな解釈と思います。There is a huge difference between thinking about doing something and actually acting upon that thought.
sen.e: It was rumored that an angry Yasuie and Okata (his mother) contemplated an attempt on Sadaaki's life, and forced into a corner, Sadaaki resigned his position as the 15th regent to the shogun on May 7, to become a priest.
sen.cmt: 日付を修正しました。

sen.e: He assumed the Shikken post only for a little more that ten days.
His regency lasted for little more than ten days.
sen.cmt: thanをthatにするなtypo
sen.e: His regency lasted for little more than 10 days.
sen.cmt: ten を 10 に修正しました。

sen.j: 貞顕の出家後、泰家と安達氏の憤りを恐れて北条一門に執権のなり手がいない中、ようやく4月24日に引付衆一番頭人北条守時が就任し、これが最後の北条氏執権となる。
sen.e: While no person in the HOJO clan wanted to assume the Shikken post, fearing the anger of Yasuie and the Adachi family, Moritoki HOJO, the chief of Hikitsukeshu (coadjustors of the high court), was at last appointed to the post on April 24 (in the old calendar), becoming the last Shikken officer of the Hojo clan.

While no person in the HOJO clan wanted to take up the regency, fearing the wrath of Yasuie and the Adachi clan, Moritoki HOJO, the chief of Hikitsukeshu (coadjustors of the high court), was at last appointed to the post on April 24, becoming the last Shikken of the HOJO clan.
sen.cmt: assumeよりtake upの方が分かりやすいと思います。
sen.e: While no person in the HOJO clan wanted to take up the regency, fearing the wrath of Yasuie and the Adachi clan, Moritoki HOJO, the chief of Hikitsukeshu (coadjustors of the high court), was at last appointed to the post on June 3, becoming the last Shikken of the HOJO clan.
sen.cmt: 日付を修正しました。

sen.j: 連署には北条維貞が就任した。
sen.e: Koresada HOJO was appointed to Rensho (assistant to Shikken).
Koresada HOJO was appointed Rensho: assistant to Shikken, the regent to the shogun.
sen.cmt: toは必要ではありません。
sen.e: Koresada HOJO was appointed rensho (assistant to regents).
sen.cmt: Rensho: assistant to Shikken, the regent to the shogun を、用語集の定訳に従い rensho (assistant to regents) に修正しました。

sen.j: 高時の嫡子邦時は執権守時が扶持する事になり、先例によって5歳で八幡宮参詣が行われ、得宗の後継者としての儀式が行われた。
sen.e: It was decided that Shikken Moritoki should help Kunitoki, Takatoki's legitimate son, and following the precedents, Kunitoki paid a visit to Hachiman-gu Shrine at an age of five, to make the ceremony for becoming the successor of the Tokuso hamily head.

It was decided that Shikken Moritoki should help Kunitoki, Takatoki's legitimate son, and in accordance with the precedent, Kunitoki paid a visit to Hachiman-gu Shrine when he was five to be inaugurated head of the Tokuso family.
sen.cmt: どしても直訳っぽくが欲しいならば”participate in the ceremony to inherit the position as ”が良いと思いますが、"to be inaugurated"の方がすっきりすると思います。
sen.e: It was decided that Shikken Moritoki should help Kunitoki, Takatoki's legitimate son, and in accordance with the precedent, Kunitoki paid a visit to Hachiman-gu Shrine when he was five to be inaugurated head of the Tokuso family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 得宗の後継者が得宗被官の血縁となり、北条氏は得宗被官に飲み込まれていく事態が発生していた。
sen.e: The successor of the Tokuso hamily head became a relative of a retainer of the Tokuso family, generating the cause that the Hojo family became swallowed into retaiers of the Tokuso family.

The successor to the position of head of the Tokuso family became a relative of a retainer of the Tokuso family, creating the situation wherein the Hojo clan became engulfed by retainers of the Tokuso family.
sen.cmt: 直訳っぽくな"generating the cause” を"creating the situation ”に変更しました。
sen.e: The successor to the position of head of the Tokuso family became a relative of a retainer of the Tokuso family, creating the situation wherein the Hojo clan became engulfed by retainers of the Tokuso family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同じ頃、平安京の朝廷でも大覚寺統と持明院統による皇位継承争いが激化していた。
sen.e: Around the same time, in the Imperial court in Heian-kyo Capital as well, the struggle for succeeding the emperor post had become serious between Daikakuji-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama) and Jimyoin-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Fukakusa).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Around the same time, in the Imperial court in Heian-kyo Capital as well, the struggle between Daikakuji-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama) and Jimyoin-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Fukakusa) to succeed the emperor had become serious.
sen.cmt: struggleを明確にするため、少し語順を変えました。
sen.e: Around the same time, in the Imperial court in Heian-kyo Capital as well, the struggle between Daikakuji-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Kameyama) and Jimyoin-to (imperial lineage starting with Emperor Fukakusa) to succeed the emperor had become serious.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのため、北条一族の内紛は政局混迷の度合いを深め、やがて正慶2年（1333年）5月の鎌倉幕府滅亡へと繋がっていく。
sen.e: Therefore, the internal strife in the Hojo clan made the political situation confused more and more seriously, then leading to the demise of the Kamakura bakufu in May (in th eold calendar), 1333.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, the internal strife in the Hojo clan made the political situation increasingly confusing, leading to the demise of the Kamakura bakufu in May (in the old calendar), 1333.
sen.cmt: Therefore, the internal strife in the Hojo clan made the political situation confused more and more seriously, 直訳っぽくの [confused more and more seriously]をincreasingly confusingに変更しました。
sen.e: Therefore, the internal strife in the Hojo clan made the political situation increasingly confusing, leading to the demise of the Kamakura bakufu in June, 1333.
sen.cmt: 「直訳っぽくの [confused more and more seriously]をincreasingly confusingに変更しました。」というコメントを、移動しました。旧暦表示の日付 May (in the old calendar) を 新暦表示 June に修正しました。
